item.title: BofA to pay $33m on bonus claims
item.description: Bank of America is to pay $33m to settle US regulators’ claims US regulators’ claims that it failed to provide complete information to investors about a $5bn bonus pool at Merrill Lynch prior to last December’s shareholder vote over the takeover of the Wall Street bank

item.title: Stocks hit highest levels for the year
item.description: Better profits than expected at some of Europe’s biggest banks and growing confidence that the recession may soon be over spurred global equities to highs for the year

item.title: Wall Street stocks rally sharply
item.description: US equities rallied sharply and the S&P 500 rose above the 1,000-point threshold for the first time since November

item.title: Google’s Schmidt quits Apple board
item.description: The close personal link that sealed an unusual alliance between Silicon Valley’s two most prominent companies was broken as growing competitive conflicts forced Eric Schmidt, Google chief executive officerof Google, to step down from his controverial controversial position as a director of Apple.

item.title: Cash-for-clunkers rebates boost US car sales
item.description: Car sales in the US were sharply up – by about 16 per cent – in July Carmakers reported a sharp increase in US sales last month compared with to June thanks to demand generated by taxpayer-funded car scrappage incentives

item.title: Clorox gets sales boost from flu outbreak
item.description: Clorox, maker of bleach and other cleaning products, joined a select group of US companies that have seen sales lifted by the H1N1 swine flu pandemic

item.title: Renewed belief in ‘decoupling’ sparks surge
item.description: Emerging stock markets have reached levels last seen before the collapse of Lehman Brothers in the latest sign of investor expectations of improving global growth

item.title: Global economy at risk from oil price rise
item.description: The world economy cannot sustain any further rise in the oil price, the International Energy Agency’s chief economist warned as prices rose toward a year high

item.title: European retail investors fuel bond-buying boom
item.description: As economic uncertainty bites, an instrument where retail investors can get their money back at maturity and an acceptable level of return for the risk is gaining in popularity

item.title: Iran poll critics boycott ceremony
item.description: Senior Iran politicians publicly challenged supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei by boycotting the ceremony in which he endorsed Mahmoud Ahmadi-Nejad as the country’s president
